verses.verse: Having received the piece of bread, he then went out immediately. And it was night.
The New Commandment So, when he had gone out, Jesus said, (John 12:23; Acts 3:13) “Now the Son of Man is glorified, and ((John 14:13; 17:4; 1 Pet. 4:11)) God is glorified in Him.
If God is glorified in Him, God will also glorify Him in Himself, and (John 12:23) glorify Him immediately.

Little children, I shall be with you a (John 12:35; 14:19; 16:16-19) little while longer. You will seek Me; (Mark 16:19; (John 7:34; 8:21); Acts 1:9) and as I said to the Jews, ‘Where I am going, you cannot come,’ so now I say to you.
(Lev. 19:18; Eph. 5:2; 1 Thess. 4:9; James 2:8; 1 Pet. 1:22; 1 John 2:7) A new commandment I give to you, that you love one another; as I have loved you, that you also love one another.
(1 John 2:5) By this all will know that you are My disciples, if you have love for one another.”

Jesus Predicts Peter’s Denial Simon Peter said to Him, “Lord, where are You going?” Jesus answered him, “Where I (John 13:33; 14:2; 16:5) am going you cannot follow Me now, but (John 21:17; 2 Pet. 1:14) you shall follow Me afterward.”
Peter said to Him, “Lord, why can I not follow You now? I will (Matt. 26:33-35; Mark 14:29-31; Luke 22:33, 34) lay down my life for Your sake.”

Jesus answered him, “Will you lay down your life for My sake? Most assuredly, I say to you, the rooster shall not (Matt. 26:74; Mark 14:30; Luke 22:61; John 18:25-27) crow till you have denied Me three times.
The Way, the Truth, and the Life “Let ((John 14:27; 16:22, 24)) not your heart be troubled; you believe in God, believe also in Me.
In My Father’s house are many mansions; if it were not so, I would have told you. (Matt. 25:34; John 13:33, 36; Heb. 11:16) I go to prepare a place for you.
And if I go and prepare a place for you, ((Acts 1:11)) I will come again and receive you to Myself; that ((John 12:26; 1 Thess. 4:17)) where I am, there you may be also.
And where I go you know, and the way you know.”
(Matt. 10:3; John 11:16; 20:24-29; 21:2) Thomas said to Him, “Lord, we do not know where You are going, and how can we know the way?”

Jesus said to him, “I am ((John 10:9; Rom. 5:2; Eph. 2:18; Heb. 9:8; 10:19, 20)) the way, ((John 1:14, 17; 8:32; 18:37)) the truth, and ((John 11:25)) the life. (1 Tim. 2:5) No one comes to the Father ((John 10:7-9; Acts 4:12)) except through Me.
The Father Revealed (John 8:19) “If you had known Me, you would have known My Father also; and from now on you know Him and have seen Him.”
Philip said to Him, “Lord, show us the Father, and it is sufficient for us.”

Jesus said to him, “Have I been with you so long, and yet you have not known Me, Philip? (John 12:45; Col. 1:15; Heb. 1:3) He who has seen Me has seen the Father; so how can you say, ‘Show us the Father’?

Do you not believe that (John 10:38; 14:11, 20) I am in the Father, and the Father in Me? The words that I speak to you (Deut. 18:18; John 5:19; 14:24) I do not speak on My own authority; but the Father who dwells in Me does the works.
Believe Me that I am in the Father and the Father in Me, (John 5:36; 10:38) or else believe Me for the sake of the works themselves.

The Answered Prayer (Matt. 21:21; Mark 16:17; Luke 10:17) “Most assuredly, I say to you, he who believes in Me, the works that I do he will do also; and greater works than these he will do, because I go to My Father.
(Matt. 7:7; (Mark 11:24); Luke 11:9; John 15:16; 16:23, 24; (James 1:5-7; 1 John 3:22)) And whatever you ask in My name, that I will do, that the Father may be (John 13:31) glorified in the Son.
If you ask anything in My name, I will do it.
Jesus Promises Another Helper (1 John 5:3) “If you love Me, keep My commandments.
And I will pray the Father, and ((John 15:26; 20:22); Acts 2:4, 33; Rom. 8:15) He will give you another Helper, that He may abide with you forever—

((John 15:26; 16:13; 1 John 4:6; 5:7)) the Spirit of truth, ((1 Cor. 2:14)) whom the world cannot receive, because it neither sees Him nor knows Him; but you know Him, for He dwells with you ((1 John 2:27)) and will be in you.
((Matt. 28:20)) I will not leave you orphans; ((John 14:3, 28)) I will come to you.

Indwelling of the Father and the Son “A little while longer and the world will see Me no more, but (John 16:16, 22) you will see Me. ((Rom. 5:10; 1 Cor. 15:20; 2 Cor. 4:10)) Because I live, you will live also.
At that day you will know that (John 10:38; 14:11) I am in My Father, and you in Me, and I in you.
(1 John 2:5) He who has My commandments and keeps them, it is he who loves Me. And he who loves Me will be loved by My Father, and I will love him and manifest Myself to him.”
(Luke 6:16; Acts 1:13) Judas (not Iscariot) said to Him, “Lord, how is it that You will manifest Yourself to us, and not to the world?”
